revised_title: Report on the Total Solar Eclipse of April 6, 1875: Observations and Methods
tldr: This report details the observations and methods used during the total solar eclipse of April 6, 1875, focusing on the use of the prismatic camera and spectroscopic camera to study the corona and chromosphere. The authors discuss the advantages and limitations of these methods and present their findings, including the potential to analyze the spectrum of the corona and chromosphere.
